--------------------
Text: Mount Le Conte (Tennessee):  At 6593 ft it is the third highest peak in the national park, behind Clingmans Dome (6,643 ft, 2,024 m) and Mount Guyot (6,621 ft, 2,018 m).
Triplets:<Mount Le Conte
2:
--------------------
<Text: Mount Le Conte (Tennessee):  It is also the highest peak that is completely within Tennessee.>
Triplets:<Mount Le Conte
3:
--------------------
Text: Mount Le Conte (Tennessee):  However, from its immediate base to its summit, Mount Le Conte is one of the highest peaks in the Appalachian Mountains rising 5,301 ft (1,616 m) from its base, near Gatlinburg, Tennessee (1,292 ft/394 m).
Triplets:<Mount Le Conte
